translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Ideas

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽8.12. Lokiyaduka🔽Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nalokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  lokiyaduka  na lokiyam dhammam paṭicca na lokiyaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na lokiyam dhamma

original: paṭicca nalokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nalokiyo
analyzed: paṭicca na lokuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na lokiyam dhammam paṭicca na lokiyaḥ
translated: A mundane idea is related to a mundane idea as a cause condition. A mundane idea is related to an un- mundane idea as a cause condition. A mundane idea is related to a mundane and an un- mundane idea as a cause condition.

original: ca nalokuttaro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nalokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nalokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ca na lokuttaraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na lokuttaram dhammam paṭicca na lokuttaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: An un-mundane idea is related to an un-mundane idea as a cause condition.

original: Nalokiyañca nalokuttarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nalokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na lokiyam ca na lokuttaram ca dhammam paṭicca na lokuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A mundane and an un-mundane idea is related to an un-mundane idea as a cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the case of cause, there are five; in the case of object, there are two; … in the case of absence, there are five. (In all cases in detail.)
